title: It would be nice to have some clarity regarding a champion's moves
body: Don't usually post on forums, but i think this is a legitimate concern that Riot needs to address. I can understand why in game the move descriptions might be a little vague, otherwise it is just confusing with a bunch of numbers and whatnot. But by this point in the game's life there should be at least an in-client description of exactly what the moves do with exactly what ratios and scaling they have, and exactly what kind of interactions they have (eg. Gangplank q not applying Luden's Echo). I don't think that's too much to ask for and i think it is a little silly that i would have to go to a third party website to find out what kind or scaling i have, or just estimate it in game. At least someone tell me this is in the works..

Mind blown.

you are forgetting every other ranged champ
Range champions aren't **melee** brother. I think you need to relearn league.

> you are forgetting every other ranged champ

You mean the champions that have **RANGED** attacks?

Not sure what everyone's talking about with GP Q being a melee BA. It's literally just a ranged AA with slightly extra damage and a gold benefit. It doesn't even say in the description that it's melee.

As for the actual topic, I don't think it's necessary to have complete rundowns in the client of what everything does. Having it all in the client allows people to spend heaps of time just looking through descriptions and ratios and whatnot and determining a perfect build/runes/masteries/skill order or whatever, which I think shouldn't happen. In my opinion, players should be made to figure out all this stuff through experience in the game with whatever Champions they want to learn.

> It doesn't even say in the description that it's melee.

It doesn't say it **is** a melee attack, it says it counts as a melee attack.
> Parrrley can crit and applies on hit effects as if a melee basic attack.

So by hovering your mouse over the ability ingame, those numbers provided aren't accurate?
(Or are those numbers only there vs AI/bot games?   In PvP I have never looked because I'm focussing on contributing/fighting)

He's giving examples. BUT he is true. Think about Singed ult for example. It literally says 'Singed drinks a potent brew of chemicals, enhancing his ability power, armor, magic resistance, movement speed, health and mana regeneration per 5 seconds. Lasts 25 seconds.' The fuck? Where are the numbers?? Doesn't even say how much regen you get.
Lol what really? ahhahhh riot needs this updated
Just have to know what abilities apply on hit effects and what abilities apply spell effects. Or both. And it always at least states that. This isn't an issue in League atm.
oh wow because it totally doesn't CLEARLY state that gp's q is treated as a melee BASIC ATTACK

> Gangplank q not applying Luden's Echo

I think that's pretty clear. It does state in the description that it's counted as a melee basic attack, which wont proc Luden's.

Definitely not in the works. But we have a pretty decent alternative right now it's called http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/ 

If you click the "ability details" tab on some abilities they will tell you things like what GP's Q can proc. It also has the standard AD and AP ratios, along with max damage for some abilities such as Graves Q.
